title.narrative: Comprehensive response to GBV in communities affected by floods in Haiti

description.narrative:
• About 2000 women are reached out through the multidimensional referral network • About 20 Women’s organisations are participating in the implementation of the Special Protection Measures in selected zones; • Sensitization and advocacy strategies are developed for legal action and prevention among community based groups in surrounding communities, reaching out about 2000 women • 36 documented cases of GBV survivors receive legal counselling ; • 50% of those counselled decide to undertake legal action.
****** NCE and reprogramming request received on 16 Dec 2009-approved by USG on 24 Dec 2009 and extended until 28 Feb 2010

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Comprehensive response to GBV in communities affected by floods in Haiti

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
